title: Rohan Devraj
text:
I am a 2nd year undergraduate student at the Georgia Institute of Technology majoring in  Industrial & Systems Engineering and pursuing a minor in computer science.
I’m especially interested in the applications of probability, statistics, optimization, and data science. Outside of academics, I’m involved in undergraduate research with the  Space Systems Optimization Group (SSOG)  where I focus on involving space logistics modeling, optimization, and Mars rover surface routing. I’m also part of a variety of campus organizations, such as the 180 Degrees Consulting club, the GT Venture Capital Club, and intramural basketball.

title: Capstone Project CMU-UHG
text: This capstone project was the culmination of the CMU SURE 2024 Bridges to Healthcare Technology Program in partnership with UnitedHealth Group. Our project was focused on the impact of adult health-related practices on juvenile health outcomes. We primarly analyzed the impact of adult health behaviors like drinking, smoking, and insufficient sleep on the child mortality rate and low birthweight percentage on a county level. Our modeling consisted of regularization techniques (lasso and ridge regression) and linear regression for predicting low birthweight as well as a decision tree to predict outcomes of child mortality.

title: Vertically Integrated Project - Autonomous and Connected Transportation Laboratory
text: As part of the sustainable travel-related objectives project team, we focused on the modeling and analysis of transportation networks to achieve sustainable travel goals (i.e., mobility, access, safety, and equity). We used mathematical modeling in Python and optimization tools like Gurobi to understand how to better meet and exceed community-level sustainable travel goals.

title: EDA Project
text: This was the first project of the Carnegie Mellon Bridges to Healthcare Technology Program with UnitedHealth Group. For this project, we created visualizations of maternal healthcare disparities across the U.S. in R and used clustering to reveal groups of distinct characteristics in the dataset, highlighting variations in healthcare access.
